stories.text:
For my startup, I have a project which has TypeScript server and client app. Workflow is much better while using mono repo with npm workspaces. Right now I am the only developer, thats fine. I am paranoid about the situation when I have multiple developer working on this project. With monorepo developers will have access to all code. Isn't it risky when one of developer go rouge and use the code to deploy it in his own server and market it? Isn't it especially risky for startup which less legal resource.

Sometime, I feel it is good approach to have server and client in different repo and have 2 different team dealing with it and have common code in git submodules. With this approach at least 2 developer have to go rouge, which is less probable.

What do you thing about this situation. Am I overthinking about situation? Is this the common problem, if so how organisations deal with it?
stories.title: Monorepo with NPM workspace right for me?
